title: Israel Invites Biden to Visit as Gaza’s Crisis Worsens Under Siege
description: President Biden weighed an extraordinary invitation to visit Israel as it readies a possible invasion of Gaza in response to terrorist attacks in Israeli history.

title: Hamas Posts Hostage Video of Woman Abducted From Israeli Music Festival
description: The video, of Mia Shem, 21, was the first Hamas has released of any of its nearly 200 hostages. It showed her being treated for an arm injury and speaking to the camera.

title: Israel Prepares for Invasion by Using Phone Data to Track Gazans Fleeing
description: The Israeli military says the tracking and the call to evacuate are to preserve as many civilian lives as possible during an expected ground invasion, even as deadly airstrikes continue.

title: U.S. and Israel Focus on Hezbollah’s Next Move After Hamas Attack
description: American officials said they believed the deployment of aircraft carrier strike groups has, at least for now, deterred Hezbollah from opening a new front in the war.

title: Tuesday Briefing: Biden Weighs a Visit to Israel
description: Plus the future of salmon farming.

title: In Legal Peril at Home, Trump Turns to a U.K. Court for Vindication
description: On a day when he lashed out at a federal judge in Washington, the former president asked a judge in London to let his lawsuit over the notorious Steele dossier go forward.

title: Two Killed in Brussels Shooting Described as Act of Terrorism
description: The suspect was at large on Monday evening as the threat level was raised. Prime Minister Alexander de Croo said the victims were Swedes.

title: Poland Begins to Look Beyond the Vote, to Unwinding an ‘Illiberal Democracy’
description: If the ballot counts hold out, the country is on the cusp of a significant change, but there will be much to do and undo.

title: Social Media Users Accuse Facebook, Instagram of Suppressing Pro-Palestinian Posts
description: Meta has cautioned that some posts may be temporarily suppressed or suspended as it sifts through millions of posts spreading across its platforms.

title: Bill Ford Says U.A.W. Strike Is Helping Tesla and Toyota
description: Mr. Ford, the executive chairman of Ford Motor, said nonunion automakers would make gains against Michigan automakers because of strikes by the United Automobile Workers union.

title: Satellite Photos Show How Russia Could Be Shipping Arms From North Korea
description: An analysis released on Monday said the images showed Moscow may be getting weapons from a North Korean port to an ammunition depot near Ukraine.

title: Stuck at Gaza’s Border With Egypt
description: Scores of foreign nationals, including many U.S. citizens, waited on the Gaza side of the Rafah border crossing with Egypt on Monday, hoping for a deal that would allow them to escape.

title: Israel Will Evacuate Towns Near Its Border With Lebanon as Tensions Escalate
description: The border has been a longtime staging ground for attacks by Hezbollah, the Iranian-backed Lebanese group.

title: Yellen Assures Europe That U.S. Will Provide More Funds for Ukraine
description: The Treasury secretary reassured allies that the Biden administration was not backing away from Ukraine despite opposition in Congress.

title: Yehya Sinwar, Hamas’s Leader in Gaza, Is At the Top of Israel’s Target List
description: Considered a brutal enforcer within Hamas, he served time in Israeli prison before being released in a 2011 prisoner swap.

title: Israel-Hamas War: Gaza Border Remains Closed for Aid; Water and Fuel Shortages Worsen
description: Western diplomats were pushing for a way to allow emergency aid into Gaza and for foreigners to exit to Egypt. Israel said at least 199 people had been taken hostage by Hamas, more than initially thought.

title: Martti Ahtisaari, Finnish Nobel Peace Prize Winner, Dies at 86
description: Best known for his role in negotiations that led to independence for Namibia, he also served as president of his country.

title: Twins Are Born in Gaza After Their Mother Flees to the South
description: Their mother left one hospital for another ahead of a possible Israeli ground invasion. The twins need formula, but water is scarce.

title: Milei Called the Pope a ‘Filthy Leftist.’ He Could Be Argentina’s Next President.
description: Javier Milei is leading the race to be Argentina’s next president. But he is dogged by his past broadsides against a fellow countryman: Pope Francis.

title: Robert Sapolsky Doesn’t Believe in Free Will. (But Feel Free to Disagree.)
description: Shedding the concept “completely strikes at our sense of identity and autonomy,” the Stanford biologist and neurologist argues. It might also be liberating.

title: Fearing Escalation, Biden Seeks to Deter Iran and Hezbollah
description: The administration has grown increasingly anxious that Israel’s enemies may seek to widen the war with Hamas and has both sent diplomatic messages and deployed military assets to prevent it.

title: A Father, an Earthquake and the Desperate Search for a Missing Son
description: Over a week since a major earthquake decimated his village in northwest Afghanistan, Noor Ahmad is on a harrowing hunt to find his 5-year-old.

title: Monday Briefing
description: Diplomats try to ease the “siege” of Gaza.

title: Biden Administration Seeks Emergency Aid Package for Both Israel and Ukraine
description: Aid to Ukraine lapsed last month amid Republican resistance, while aid for Israel in its war with Hamas has drawn bipartisan support in recent days.

title: Biden Warns Israel Not to Occupy Gaza
description: While the president has stood strongly behind Israel since Hamas attacked, he said on “60 Minutes” that a new occupation of Gaza would “be a big mistake.”

title: As Israeli Invasion Looms, Diplomats Seek to Meet Gaza’s Dire Human Needs
description: The U.S., Egypt and other countries are urging the delivery of food, water and fuel to counter the desperate shortages facing Gaza’s two million residents.
